venue.name: Tavern on the Water "Sand Bar" on the Pier Level

item.description:
Below is a write up of the place I discovered last week. We can meet there for drinks to talk about life on the water. We'll have sand between our toes!

Take the 10 minute ferry from Boston Long Wharf (Aquarium) to Charlestown Navy Yard. Then it's just a few picturesque blocks northeast to Pier 6. You can see it from the ferry on the way over. Just be sure to get back for the 8PM return ferry before it stops running. Or you can try to park nearby, but that is not as much fun as the ferry. http://www.mbta.com/schedules_and_maps/boats/lines/?route=F4

This is the view of Boston from the Deck of the Sand Bar.

The Sandlot
Tavern on the Water, Now with Sand Pop quiz.

How much sand it take to turn a regular Charlestown bar into a beach bar?
Time’s up.

Answer: seven tons.

In case you need some proof: say hello to the Tavern on the Water Sand Bar, a beach-ified transformation of the beloved pier bar.

First, let’s be clear. A favorite Charlestown destination with the killer city views is still just that. The big difference: the downstairs patio now has seven tons of sand dropped on it. It covers the entire 200 person seating area for the rest of this season.

So get your mind thinking about tomorrow afternoon (shouldn’t be hard). You’ll roll in here with a few friends (all fully flip-flopped) and grab your regular table. You’ll order up pitchers of Drunken Sailors (rum, lemonade) and a few dozen Maine lobster rolls. Only now you’ll kick back above a bed of sand (sand between toes = happier you).


Read more: http://www.urbandaddy.com/bos/nightlife/18030/Tavern_on_the_Water_Sand_Bar_Tavern_on_the_Water_Now_with_Sand_Boston_BOS_Bunker_Hill_Restaurant#ixzz1yUHt1u5E
